channel.title: Culture on UN-aligned
channel.description: Recent content in Culture on UN-aligned

item.title: More than Just a Gay Icon: Edmund White (1940-2025)
item.author: alex.liberto
item.description: June began with the death of two literary giants: Edmund White (died June 3, 2025 at 85) and Frederick Forsyth (died June 9,2025 at 86). Our literary editor, Alex Liberto, had met and corresponded with the former and has written this touching tribute.

item.title: How Michelangelo’s "Fruit Basket" captures the fleeting essence of life
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: In Caravaggio's 'Fruit Basket', a mere wicker basket and its contents emerge as a profound meditation on life, light and the passage of time, showcasing the artist's early genius.

item.title: How Caravaggio's 'The Burial of Saint Lucy' Transforms the Divine into the Earthly
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: Caravaggio's portrayal, St. Lucy forsakes heavenly glory for a gritty burial scene, which reflects the artist's personal struggles and innovative use of light.

item.title: 'Transcending Strokes': Caravaggio's Unmistakable Emotion in "Judith and Holofernes"
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: Unveiling the emotional tension in Caravaggio's 'Judith and Holofernes,' a dramatic narrative of good versus evil comes to light through distinctive stylistic elements.

item.title: English Poetry After WWII: The Rise and Evolution of Post-War Literature in The UK
item.author: alex.liberto
item.description: In a world recovering from the devastation of war, how did English literature find its footing? Here are the most pivotal figures and movements that reshaped the post-war literary landscape.

item.title: Caravaggio's Crucifixion of St. Peter: The Unseen Heroism
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: Caravaggio's 1601 Crucifixion of St. Peter showcases mastery of light, human detail and transformative narrative in this iconic Baroque masterpiece.

item.title: Michael Torke's 'Being': Dreadful Art Cover, Glorious Music
item.author: Ariana Yekrangi
item.description: Michael Torke's 'Being' is a transfixing 43-minute composition that shimmers with infectious energy, despite its lacklustre album cover.

item.title: The Conversion of St. Paul by Caravaggio: A Masterpiece of Dramatic Intensity and Transformative Power
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: An analysis of Caravaggio's The Conversion of St. Paul and its representation of the powerful transformation of the future apostle.

item.title: The Rise of the Angry Young Men in British Drama
item.author: alex.liberto
item.description: Exploring social injustice and generation gap in post-war Britain drama through the works of John Osborne and other playwrights of the Angry Young Men movement.

item.title: More Than a Mere Copycat? The Rise of AI-Generated Art and its Implications
item.author: Dinojah.Patkunarajah
item.description: Can AI art really be considered true art? The debate is heating up as many see this new technology as a mere copycat, while others argue that it has the potential to elevate human creativity to new heights.

item.title: A Detailed Look at the Ancient Nativity Fresco in the Catacombs of Santa Priscilla
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: Dive deeper into the history and symbolism of early Christian art with our analysis of the ancient Nativity Fresco in the Catacombs of Santa Priscilla, Rome

item.title: British Drama in the Age of Self-Discovery: Significant Plays and Key Themes
item.author: alex.liberto
item.description: Uncovering the hidden gems of 20th century British drama.

item.title: The Story of My Great Uncle Pamfilo of Magliano
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: Pamfilo of Magliano (Giovanni Paolo Pietrobattista) was a Franciscan friar who lived a life characterised by intelligence, determination, and resilience, writes Carla, Giovanni’s great niece.

item.title: How the age of self-discovery changed the English poetry and novel forever
item.author: alex.liberto
item.description: The Age of Self-Discovery was a milestone for the English poetry and novel that opened the doors for the intellectual creativity and innovation of 20th-century writers.

item.title: Dante Alighieri's Vision for World Government: The Pathway to Abolishing War
item.author: Tad Daley
item.description: Dante's death 700 years ago marked the end of an era. But his lasting legacy may be his vision for a world government, outlined in his work De Monarchia.

item.title: 86 Billion: The human spirt's fight to live a meaningful life
item.author: unregisteredauthor
item.description: Poems for a better world is collection of poems composed by UN-aligneders for a better better and fairer future.

item.title: David Herbert Lawrence: The Freudian who hated industrialisation
item.author: alex.liberto
item.description: David Herbert Lawrence has captivated the imagination with his rich and substantial prose, painting a clear picture of reality with spontaneous language.

item.title: Caravaggio and the unveiling of truth
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: Each of us is constantly torn between comfortable facade truths, and those deep and real truths that sometimes elude us. For most people, it is relatively easy to keep the uncomfortable aspects of authentic truths hidden. In the case of artists, on the other hand, especially the best known ones, this secrecy is lost because their lives, and their works, are often under the lens of historical and stylistic research.

item.title: Poems for a Better World: Stop this rape in Ukraine
item.author: unregisteredauthor
item.description: Gruesome rape and torment in Ukraine, Causing women and children agonising pain. Horrific headlines curdles one to the bone.Russian soldiers have no hearts of their own...

item.title: Today's London through the eyes of an old Communist hag
item.author: CristinaMihailescu
item.description: London has always been my dream. Ever since my first English lesson, back in 1974, I have imagined myself wandering along its famous streets, visiting its exquisite monuments, but the city was unlike anything I imagined it to be.

item.title: Petronilla Paolini: Her tragic life and daring poems
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: Born in 1663, Petronilla Paolini broke through society's patriarchal cage with the only weapon she had at her disposal, her art... writes Carla Pietrobattista.

item.title: Unlocked and Unbolted: Virginia Woolf's Life and Works
item.author: alex.liberto
item.description: Virginia Woolf and her tumultuous psychological hardships should be considered an essential cornerstone of modernist fiction.

item.title: Graffiti through history: 3 magnificent examples
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: Who makes graffiti? Street children who vandalise walls or mysterious artists whose works are worth millions? You may be surprised to know these three historical graffiti.

item.title: Doni Tondo: A Visual Analysis of Michelangelo's Masterpiece
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: Located in the gallery of Uffizi, Michelangelo’s Doni Tondo (Tondo Doni) portrays the holy family and represents a unicum in Michelangelo's artistic production.

item.title: The Hidden Curse of Babel: The Drawbacks of Language for Communication and Thought
item.author: Adrian Liberto
item.description: This article highlights the drawbacks of language, not only in its cursed post-Babel scattered metamorphosis, but also in itself, as a means to communication and thought.

item.title: Doris Lessing: Subjecting a Divided Civilisation to Scrutiny
item.author: alex.liberto
item.description: Doris Lessing, a female writer who weighed in on the feminist front and who wrote about persecution, intolerance and injustice.

item.title: The last judgement of Michelangelo Buonarroti
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: How Michelangelo created the last judgement.

item.title: Edward Morgan Forster: Life and works
item.author: alex.liberto
item.description: Edward Morgan Forster: his life and his works.

item.title: Why Russian and Ukrainian are not the same language
item.author: Anonymous
item.description: As the Ukrainian invasion enters its third month, we explore the difference between Russian and Ukrainian language, which are often mistaken as the same.

item.title: Like Rings in The Water: Dante’s impact on Michelangelo
item.author: carlapietrobattista
item.description: The divine complexity of Dante's Commedia has not only produced sterile admiration but has been able to generate new art in all the shapes and forms. This piece looks at Dante's impact on the Michelangelo.
